Posts.Content:
Did they do a biospy as well? If not, that could be the next step. You should ask your doctor to explain the results to you and ask if a biospy is needed. In my case - I am now 43, was diagnosed last june, I had a mammograph and a biospy right after. A week later I had an MRI and CT scan (and more).
Good luck!
Sheila
Posts.Title: Questions about mammogram recall....

Posts.Content:
I'm afraid I can't help you with interpreting the medical report. But one thing I can suggest is that you ask for an MRI or CT scan as soon as possible, since these scans are more precise. 
Good luck and don't worry too much. Exams, scans amd biopsies are tough because you have to wait for the results. Keep us posted!
Sheila
Posts.Title: Another concerned newbie

Posts.Content:
Sheila, 43, from The Netherlands, also lived in CA, PA, TX, and OR for 11 yrs. Dx in june 2012 with stage IV breast cancer after blood discharge from nipple. Tumor is 2,7 cm, tumor area is 7 cm in right breast, 2 lymph nodes and metastasized to liver. Liver was in bad shape (bilirubin at 50). 10 weeks of AC, 2 weeks hospitalization due to neutr
openia, mucositis, stomasitis and strepthroat. Received two treatments of Mitomycin with great results - halted cancer growth in liver. Currently on 2nd cycle of Xeloda. Liver stabilized and tumor appears in remission. 
Thanks for this forum!
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share
